item.title: Football: The World’s Most Popular Sport
item.description:
Football, also known as soccer in some countries, is the most widely played and watched sport in the world. Played by two teams of eleven players each, the objective of the game is to score goals by getting the ball into the opponent’s net.

item.description: Md Tarek Hossain: As the clock ticks down to Bangladesh’s looming trade deadline with the United States, a fresh deal between Washington and Tokyo has added urgency—and pressure—to Dhaka’s ongoing negotiations. Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba...

item.title: E-traceability in fish exports: A new horizon for Bangladesh’s economic growth
item.description: Sakif Shamim: The fisheries sector has long played a vital role in Bangladesh’s economy. It contributes significantly to our GDP and provides employment to millions of people. At present, fish exports from Bangladesh amount to nearly USD 500 million....

item.title: US looks forward to continued engagement with Bangladesh: Miller
item.description:
The United States (US) has expressed its commitment to ongoing cooperation with Bangladesh to address challenges related to economic stability, democracy, security, and the Rohingyas, State Department spokesperson said on Tuesday.

item.title: UN Secretary General Guterres leaves Dhaka
item.description:
United Nations (UN) Secretary-General Antonio Guterres left here at 9:55am today ending his successful four-day visit.
Environment Adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan and Chief Adviser's High Representative for Rohingya Crisis Khalilur Rahman saw him off...

item.title: CA requests Trump to hold up new tariff regime for three months
item.description:
Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus today sent a letter to US President Donald Trump requesting him to postpone the application of a 37 percent tariff on Bangladeshi products in the US market.
The Chief Adviser's Office (CAO) confirmed it to BS...

item.title: July protesters shot point blank in some cases: UN
item.description: State security forces and Awami League men were involved in crimes against humanity during the July uprising as the security forces in some cases shot defenceless protesters from point blank range to kill them, said a United Nations (UN) report said....

item.title: Bangladesh announces three-day state mourning on passing of Pope Francis
item.description:
The Bangladesh government has declared a three-day state mourning beginning today, following the death of Pope Francis, head of the Catholic Church.
The Cabinet Division issued a notification to this end on Wednesday night.
